description:
2013-12-14 03:57:13.997 | Traceback (most recent call last):
2013-12-14 03:57:13.998 |   File "tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver_negative.py", line 124, in test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved
2013-12-14 03:57:13.998 |     self.client.wait_for_image_status(image_id, 'ACTIVE')
2013-12-14 03:57:13.998 |   File "tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py", line 96, in wait_for_image_status
2013-12-14 03:57:13.998 |     raise exceptions.TimeoutException
2013-12-14 03:57:13.998 | TimeoutException: Request timed out

http://logs.openstack.org/50/55750/11/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/3bfb47c/console.html.gz

We should at least make that timeout exception message better, i.e. dump the status that we're waiting for vs the current status to help debug these fails.

I'm not seeing any obvious fails in the glance api or registry logs.
title: TimeoutException waiting for image status in test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved

We should at least make that timeout exception message better, i.e. dump the status that we're waiting for vs the current status to help debug these fails.

I'm not seeing any obvious fails in the glance api or registry logs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Seeing lots of errors like this in the nova logs but they appear to be whitelisted:

2013-12-14 03:38:58.243 25389 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: 3d9e5911-ca38-4c92-8f8a-b72962475101] During wait destroy, instance disappeared.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
This is the wait for image status method called:

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py#L83

This looks like a nicer one that the image api tests are using which provides a better timeout message:

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/services/image/v1/json/image_client.py#L263
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
in nova-api I see:

2014-08-19 16:02:36.041 ERROR nova.image.s3 [req-5375078d-445a-4983-839e-ab123345d6a6 S3ImagesTest-1579885285 S3ImagesTest-1199530769] Failed to untar bucket--934449541/cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-vmlinuz.manifest.xml to /tmp/tmpELsjI


Perhaps this is a disk space issue?
